title: C04-1128

sentences.text: While sentence extraction as an approach to summarization has been shown to work in documents of certain genres , because of the conversational nature of email communication where utterances are made in relation to one made previously , sentence extraction may not capture the necessary segments of dialogue that would make a summary coherent .
In this paper , we present our work on the detection of question-answer pairs in an email conversation for the task of email summarization .
We show that various features based on the structure of email-threads can be used to improve upon lexical similarity of discourse segments for question-answer pairing .

kg2text: Our work on detecting question-answer pairs in email conversations for the task of email summarization has a broader term, which is email summarization. This paper presents research that focuses on improving upon lexical similarity of discourse segments for question-answer pairing using features based on the structure of email threads. These features can be used to improve upon sentence extraction as an approach to summarizing documents of certain genres. Furthermore, our work has a broader term, which is task. The process or goal of condensing and highlighting essential information from emails, also known as email summarization, is itself a task that aims to achieve a specific objective.
